description: From Middle Dutch mudseken (“mutchkin”), from mutse (“mutch”), from Classical Latin modius (“peck; Roman dry measure”), from Proto-Indo-European *med-.

entries.meaning: (Scotland) A unit of fluid capacity approximately equal to three-quarters of an imperial pint (0.43 litres)
examples: Paint Scotland greetin owre her thrissle;
Her mutchkin stowp as toom's a whissle;
An' damn'd excisemen in a bussle,
